description: A highly porous volcanic rock that forms during explosive eruptions.
A sedimentary rock composed of fine silt-sized particles.
An ultramafic igneous rock composed mostly of olivine.
An igneous rock famous for sometimes containing diamonds.
A clastic sedimentary rock with angular fragments cemented together.
A metamorphic rock with a fine-grained texture and a silky sheen.
A hard, fine-grained sedimentary rock composed primarily of silica.
A soil and rock type rich in iron and aluminum, formed in tropical climates.
A metamorphic rock rich in green minerals such as chlorite and epidote.
A volcanic rock high in silica content, often forming from lava flows.
A metamorphic rock dominated by talc, giving it a soft and greasy feel.
An igneous rock known for large crystals and rare minerals.
A fine-grained sedimentary rock formed from compacted mud and clay.
A naturally occurring volcanic glass formed from rapidly cooled lava.
An igneous rock similar to granite but with little or no quartz.
A rare igneous rock composed predominantly of carbonate minerals.
A type of limestone formed by mineral springs, often used in building.
A hard sedimentary rock often used historically for tools and fire-starting.
An igneous rock composed almost entirely of plagioclase feldspar.
A metamorphic rock formed from sandstone, highly resistant to weathering.
